@graph.creator: Loch, Christian
@graph.title: Entwicklung von In vitro-Modellen zur Charakterisierung von ophthalmologischen Arzneiformen
abstract: In modern ophthalmology injections and implants were administered in periocular regions or directly in the vitreous body. In the development of innovative ophthalmic injections and implants the in vitro characterization of the drug release and distribution is of high importance. Currently used in vitro methods do not simulate the in vivo situation sufficient enough. On the one hand the ophthalmic tissues, such as the conjunctiva or the sclera, operate as barriers for the transport of active agents to the site of action. On the other hand the influence of the conjunctival and choroidal blood vessels has to be considered regarding ophthalmic distribution and elimination processes. In the present work the permeability behavior of various ophthalmic tissues was examined. As results the permeability coefficients of ciprofloxacin, lidocaine, timolol and dexamethasone for the sclera, conjunctiva, cornea, retina-choroidea-complex as well as for combinations of the mentioned tissues of the porcine, rabbit and cow eye were obtained. The comparison between the species showed large differences in the permeability coefficients. Therefore the transferability of the obtained results between the different species or to human should be treated with caution. To establish the permeability behavior of the ophthalmic tissues in an in vitro model, synthetic membranes with similar permeability coefficients to the porcine eye were identified and mounted in a new developed double layer flow through ...
Ophthalmologie, Permeabilität, In vitro-Modell, Glaskörper, Wirkstoffverteilung, Permeabilitätskoeffizient, permeability coefficient, pericular injection, intravitreal injection, in vitro
